title: SM U-167
text:
SM "U-167" was one of the 329 <a href="submarine">submarine</a>s serving in the <a href="Imperial%20German%20Navy">Imperial German Navy</a> in <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>.
"U-167" would have been engaged in <a href="Naval%20warfare%20of%20World%20War%20I">naval warfare</a> and taken part in the <a href="First%20Battle%20of%20the%20Atlantic">First Battle of the Atlantic</a>, but it was not commissioned until the end of the war.
Design.
<a href="German%20Type%20U%2093%20submarine">German Type U 93 submarine</a>s were preceded by the shorter <a href="German%20Type%20U%2087%20submarine">Type U 87 submarines</a>. "U-167" had a displacement of when at the surface and while submerged. She had a total length of , a <a href="pressure%20hull">pressure hull</a> length of , a <a href="beam%20%28nautical%29">beam</a> of , a height of , and a <a href="draught%20%28ship%29">draught</a> of . The submarine was powered by two engines for use while surfaced, and two engines for use while submerged. She had two propeller shafts and two propellers. She was capable of operating at depths of up to .
The submarine had a maximum surface speed of and a maximum submerged speed of . When submerged, she could operate for at ; when surfaced, she could travel at . "U-167" was fitted with six <a href="torpedo%20tube">torpedo tube</a>s (four at the bow and two at the stern), twelve to sixteen <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a>es, and one <a href="10.5%26amp%3Bnbsp%3Bcm%20SK%20L/45%20naval%20gun">SK L/45</a> <a href="deck%20gun">deck gun</a>. She had a <a href="Ship%27s%20company">complement</a> of thirty-six (thirty-two crew members and four officers).
